ygData.subject: Re: Ice Comet
ygData.msgSnippet: I have had no problem soloing through L14.  In fact, I tend to get exp faster that way, it seems.  I do believe that grouping is better for enjoying the game,
ygData.messageBody:
I have had no problem soloing through L14. In fact, I tend to get exp
faster that way, it seems. I do believe that grouping is better for
enjoying the game, but when you can't find a competent group, soloing is
viable for the long haul.

Right now I solo caiman in Oasis. I still sit near the zone border, but I
have killed 20 or so and never lost. Did have to pull out the snake fang
once, but I still got him.

Groups are better, but with a little practice you should have no fear of
soloing. Just make sure you test the creature out near a guard or zone
before you jump in.

>According to Ken Morris:
> > For the record, I don't believe wizards should solo past 5th lvl. Your
> > chances of dying increase dramatically when soloing. Having said that,
>we
>
>If you know what you take in. For example, I'm now soloing (at 9th) Desert
>Tarantula, because, by experience, these critters don't hit me enough. The
>only time it is borderline is when I get three fizzle in the fight. *Then*
>I start to sweat. At 10th, I know I'll get into Sand Scarabs, because these
>guys are almost doable on my own right now (if I don't get a fizzle at
>all).
>
>When soloing, the trick is to know which target to hunt. Pumas are
>significantly
>weaker than Tarantulas, but they tend to hit more often (without Poison),
>so
>I usually end up with less HP remaining after a fight with a Puma.
>
> > strategize carefully and leave yourself a way to escape if things go
>bad,
> > there's no lvl that you can't solo.
>
>Agreed.
>
>--
